news.title: First migrant deported to France under new returns deal
news.summary: The man was removed on Thursday under the "one in, one out" agreement and has arrived in Paris.

news.title: Three arrested on suspicion of spying for Russia
news.summary: The two men and a woman were all arrested in Grays, Essex, the Metropolitan Police says.

news.title: US TV host Jimmy Kimmel taken off air over Charlie Kirk comments
news.summary: The late-night host said on Monday that Trump's allies were "doing everything they can to score political points from" Kirk's death.

news.title: Katty Kay: Why America is at a dangerous crossroads following the Charlie Kirk shooting
news.summary: This moment has parallels with other periods of discord in US history, but it is more complicated than simply repeating them.

news.title: US firms pledge Â£150bn investment in UK, as Starmer hosts Trump
news.summary: The UK government hopes the investment will create more than 7,600 "high-quality jobs".

news.title: Thousands of workers across France strike over budget cut plans
news.summary: The widespread walkouts come less than a fortnight after the government collapsed over a proposed budget.

news.title: Macrons to offer 'scientific evidence' to US court to prove Brigitte is a woman, lawyer says
news.summary: They have filed a lawsuit against US right-wing influencer Candace Owens who claims the French first lady was born male.

news.title: Leonardo DiCaprio on why his new film addresses 'divisiveness in our culture'
news.summary: The actor says his latest film, One Battle After Another, "holds a mirror up to society".

news.title: 'I'm taking life day by day, year by year': Tennis legend Bjorn Borg on cancer diagnosis
news.summary: Tennis legend Bjorn Borg speaks to BBC Breakfast about his prostate cancer diagnosis and his rivalry-turned-friendship with John McEnroe.

news.title: Fashion risks going backwards on diversity, says ex-British Vogue editor
news.summary: Edward Enninful says being "super-thin" and European is often seen as "the norm" again.
